messages.title: 5 POSITIVE REASONS FOR BOB DALRYMPLE
messages.content: To save our failing economy; To get a strong local advocate; To push for openness in UK politics

messages.title: A RECORD OF ACTION IN STIRLING
messages.content: Action in the community; Tackling crime and vandalism

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Bob Dalrymple has outlined his vision to save Stirling. He wants to reduce the tax burden on local businesses, simplify VAT and remove the needless layers of bureaucracy that stifle the spirit of enterprise.
Bob Dalrymple wants to protect rural communities from old Labour 'big government' initiatives and will work to keep essential services like post offices, schools and transport links.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Stirling is a close two-way battle between Labour and the Conservatives.

issues.economy: Bob Dalrymple has outlined his vision to save Stirling. He wants to reduce the tax burden on local businesses, simplify VAT and remove the needless layers of bureaucracy that stifle the spirit of enterprise.
issues.governance: To push for openness in UK politics; Bob's expenses promise

leaflet.personalStatement: Bob Dalrymple will work tirelessly for STIRLING and be a strong local voice in Parliament.

politicalExperience.achievements: Action in the community has included beach clean-ups, Social Action Projects like volunteersâ€™ co-operative delivery of welfare, the Quaker Garden in Kings Park, the Recycle Centre bed and local volunteer Rangers planting of wildflower area and planned new shrubs and flowers in the city.

contactInformation.address: The Scottish Conservative and Unionist Party, 83 Princes Street, Edinburgh, EH2 2ER
